password is not supplied.

vulnerabilities.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
vulnerabilities.description:
Found `subprocess` function `pop` with `shell=True`. This is dangerous because this call will
spawn the command using a shell process. Doing so propagates current shell settings and
variables,
which makes it much easier for a malicious actor to execute commands. Use `shell=False`
instead.

vulnerabilities.name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
vulnerabilities.title: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
vulnerabilities.description:
Avoid using `pickle`, which is known to lead to code execution vulnerabilities.
When unpickling, the serialized data could be manipulated to run arbitrary code.
Instead, consider serializing the relevant data as JSON or a similar text-based
serialization format.

vulnerabilities.name: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.title: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
vulnerabilities.description:
Detected MD5 hash algorithm which is considered insecure. MD5 is not
collision resistant and is therefore not suitable as a cryptographic
signature. Use SHA256 or SHA3 instead.
